body:
hi,
Is there any update on this one? What is the current pending issues for this one to be merged?
thanks,
Ming
The changes on TM side look good.
Looks good to me. Is this the old Java problem of the destructor not being called on objects until they are garbage-collected? Which might be a long time?

Looks like the code will work for "_SALT_", but there is a bug there that I think will prevent it from working for "_DIVISION_nnn_". (Note: There should be underscores inside the quotes in my comment here, but github treats them as metacharacters to set italics font.)

Thanks Sean for fixing this issue. 

One question - the new connection (line 713) - recoveryTableConnection - is needed for a remote TLOG or could the existing connection be used here also ?

Hi Arvind.  I think it might be able to use the existing connection, but I didn't have a chance to test it.  That code should be the exception, though so we should not see too many connections from there.  I can test this and provide another patch if it is successful.

Dave, I don't think it's the destructor because I did explicitly call connection.close, but this seems to just put them in CLOSE_WAIT, instead of actually closing them.

---

From: DaveBirdsall notifications@github.com
Sent: Monday, February 29, 2016 9:38 AM
To: apache/incubator-trafodion
Cc: Sean Broeder
Subject: Re: [incubator-trafodion] Sean traf (#345)

Looks good to me. Is this the old Java problem of the destructor not being called on objects until they are garbage-collected? Which might be a long time?

## 

Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/345#issuecomment-190304472.
Thanks Sean. Maybe the unknownTableConnection was leaking earlier, or deleteStaleConnection call didn't close these connections, since all connections in my environment were established.
Could the reviewers please comment if all the concerns have been addressed ? One was regarding creation and usage of system roles. Other was related to unit tests with security enabled.
Code changes look good to me. Thank You.
Aside from one place where there might need to be a null pointer check, these code changes look good to me.
jenkins, retest -- major start-up issues on one test VM
Change looks great. Good work Selva.
Change looks good Hans. Thank you for offering to take on this JIRA.
Looks good to me Roberta. Thanks.

thanks all, I will try to use NAColumn() functions instead of creating a new buggy function...
And add a regression test.
To answer Hans question, when creating two tables, A and B, while B create a Foreign Key constraint on A.a, we found out if table A is created with SALT, the functionality is broken. So we have to create A without partition as workaround.
Debug for a while, here  is what I understand: To find out if RI is meet, the 'insert into b' statement will generate a query to search in table A, but this new query has a problem to add all key columns, if there are some Trafodion auto-generated colunns like '_SALT_', since at the left side of the predicate, it only add the FK column in table B, but at right side, it add referenced column with those system columns, but the predicate cannot calculate the SALT at this point. It can caculate SALT at this point, but it is much difficult, so simply remove those column is the simplest way to solve this.  
It is hard to explain, since I am not fully understand all the logic here, so yes, I should test more.

Thanks very much for the explanation. My guess is that we use the clustering key on the right side. What we should be using is the primary key - just those columns mentioned in the PRIMARY KEY clause. That would be the ideal fix, but using the NAColumn methods and exclusing salt and division columns should work as well.

Thanks for fixing this!

Looks good to me. Having a schema DB__LIBMGR and granting privileges only to DB__LIBMGRROLE is a good solution, I think. I am ready to commit - but let me know first if you want to change the role to DB__LIBMGRROLE - with two underscores. I am also sorry for any delay I have caused!

Initialize spjs:

Changes will start shortly to add initialize spj code.  This code can be committed before the initialize changes are completed.  A new JIRA will be written for this work - here are the planned changes:

Add an “initialize trafodion, init_procedures” option – If someone want this feature, they will just need to perform this command

(Since the schema below is a system schema, to follow the naming convention of other system schemas, the name should be something like "_LIBMGR_" but I could also support "DB__LIBMGR".)

The init_procedures option:

 Creates a private schema DB__LIBMGR  owned by DB__ROOT
 Creates library called DB__LIBMGRNAME in the DB__LIBMGR schema. The corresponding jar file is located: ${MY_SQROOT}/export/lib/lib_mgmt.jar
      (assume this jar file exists when the library is created – it not operation fails)
  Creates all the routines described in the init_libmgmt.sh script
  If authorization is enabled: call “initialize authorization, upgrade” to complete the request

  If the schema, library, routines, and privileges are already setup, this command is a no-op and returns “okay”.

Change “initialize trafodion, upgrade” command - The next time we support an upgrade, this will upgrade a system that did not yet perform an “init_procedures” - this can also be postponed until we support an official upgrade

Perform the same steps as init_procedures does – create the schema, libraries, and procedures.  Then upgrade authorization.

Change “initialize trafodion” command – this is a fresh installation

Before initializing authorization,  create the schema, library and routines
Then continue with initializing authorization

Change “initialize authorization, upgrade” - 

Create the DB_LIBMGRROLE – if not exists
Grant execute privilege on routines, if the routines exist

Change “initialize authorization” to 

Create the DB_LIBMGRROLE – if not exists
Grant execute privilege on routines, if the routines exist

Since SPJ’s are initialized during “initialize trafodion”, all regressions run through daily builds will work.
However, for environments that do not perform an “initialize trafodion”, then a manual ““initialize trafodion, init_procedures” is required.  Any regression tests that use this feature should include the “initialize trafodion, init_procedures” command.  If they are already initialized, this is a no-op.

Since routines may change more frequently than upgrades, need to think a bit about how to make it easy to add, drop and modify these functions and procedures.
I was able to run full regressions applying the patch of PR #345 .  All tests passed except charsets/TEST012.  I am looking into this issue.
This will need some rework. Please do not merge.
This PR is ready to be merged. The recent commit have no effect on the check-PR job.
It can't be merged yet; github suggests there are conflicts.
I am attempting to merge resolving the conflicts. I hope it is ok to do that.

Didn't look at the code in all detail, but at a high level it looks good to me. For me, the question is what the SQL semantics of an upsert are supposed to be. I think it's ok to define it in the way that TRAF_UPSERT_WITH_INSERT_DEFAULT_SEMANTICS 'ON' does. So, I would argue that we could leave this CQD set to ON as the built-in default. The current solution, OFF, is ok with me as well.

My reason to argue for the ON semantics is this: If the user wanted to merge new and existing rows, they should use the MERGE statement, not UPSERT. UPSERT, IMHO, should insert or replace entire rows, not merge old and new rows. That's cleaner semantics.
I am also ok with either of them. Let's get some more votes from the community and then I will change it to 'ON' by default.  It also have the added advantage of  performing better than merge.

The risk with doing that is that the merge changes don’t go through testing
before hitting the branch. So there is possibility of breaking the branch.
So, how “ok” it is depends on how big/risky the conflicts are.

--Steve

_To:_ apache/incubator-trafodion incubator-trafodion@noreply.github.com

fixes Upsert with omitted default value columns leave the … (#340)

I am attempting to merge resolving the conflicts. I hope it is ok to do
that.

—
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
https://github.com/apache/incubator-trafodion/pull/340#issuecomment-190832983
.

Oh. I didn't think from that angle at all. Fortunately, this conflict was in DefaultConstants.h because this change included a new CQD. It is a minor conflict in the sense both changes should be included.
Looks good to me. Some questions though might (or might not!) prompt follow-on work.
Closing since we don't want source .ai files in the source tree.
Previous Test Aborted. New Check Test Started: https://jenkins.esgyn.com/job/Check-PR-master/486/

It is not easy to use NAColumn's isXXX() method. The caller does not set attributes like is-salt-column properly. For the SALT column, isSaltColumn() return false ... ...
Where to create all the NAColumns is rather complex, I need much more time to investigate it.
Perhaps you could fix the bug with the "_DIVISION_" columns in BindRI.cpp, and then we can commit this request?
I did not check the content of the two new guides, but the other changes look good to me.
Looks good to me. I suppose we should commit this as soon as tests pass?
